newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albanian unrest spreads to north-sources.
newsitem.headline: Albanian unrest spreads to north-sources.

text.p: Unrest gripping Albania spread to the north of the country for the first time on Tuesday when a military barracks was looted of arms, government sources said.
The incident occurred in the northern town of Bajram Curri, located in area regarded as solidly behind embattled President Sali Berisha, but officials were unable to give further details.
The incident occurred as armed insurgents in the south of Albania, angered by heavy losses due to the collapse of pyramid investment schemes, seized towns and arms.
Describing the looting of the barracks in Bajram Curri, one government official told Reuters: "It is difficult for me to give more details, but it seems that people just wanted to be armed.
"They went to the barracks and looted weapons and ammunition without meeting any resistance."

Bajram Curri is in the far north of Albania, close to the border with Yugoslavia's mainly Albanian-populated Kosovo region. It is geographically far removed from the southern region where the unrest began.
